With regard to extreme trauma in childhood, this study develops the following hypotheses: the overwhelming, shattering blow of an external event is met by an equally strong, archaic defence, even in the historical situation itself, as an escape from the unbearable, unspeakable pain; the Janus face of the victim/perpetrator introject is manifest in the masochistic character-structure; these splits can be attenuated in the course of a person's life, with the appropriate help, although they cannot be fully integrated.
